Category.Name: SequenceControl
Category.ToolTip: This category includes items that control the sequencer feature
Category.Description: The controls for the sequencer feature allow enabling/disabling the feature, establishing individual sequence sets, storing and loading them, defining the mode for advance from one set to the next as images are acquired, and the source controlling the advance.

Boolean.Name: SequenceEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the sequencer
Boolean.Description: Enables the existing sequence sets for image acquisition.

Command.Name: SequenceAsyncRestart
Command.ToolTip: Allows asynchronous restart of the sequence of sequence sets
Command.Description: Allows to restart the sequence of sequence sets to image acquisition, starting with the sequence set of lowest index number. The restart is asynchronous to the cameras's frame trigger. Only available in Auto and Controlled sequence advance mode.

Command.Name: SequenceAsyncAdvance
Command.ToolTip: Allows asynchronous advance from one sequence set to the next
Command.Description: Allows to advance from the current sequence set to the next one. The advance is asynchronous to the cameras's frame trigger. Only available in Controlled sequence advance mode.

Integer.Name: SequenceCurrentSet
Integer.ToolTip: Current sequence set
Integer.Description: Indicates the current sequence set.

Integer.Name: SequenceSetTotalNumber
Integer.ToolTip: Total number of sequence sets
Integer.Description: Sets the total number of sequence sets in the sequence.

Integer.Name: SequenceSetIndex
Integer.ToolTip: Selects the index number of a sequence set
Integer.Description: Selects the index number of a sequence set.

Command.Name: SequenceSetLoad
Command.Description: Loads an existing sequence set to make it the current sequence set.

Command.Name: SequenceSetStore
Command.Description: Stores the current sequence set as one of the sequence sets of the sequence. Note: Storing the current sequence set will overwrite any already existing sequence set bearing the same index number. Note: The sequence set is stored in the volatile memory and will therefore be lost if the camera is reset or if power is switched off.

Integer.Name: SequenceSetExecutions
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the number of sequence set executions
Integer.Description: Sets the number of consecutive executions per sequence cycle for the selected sequence set. Only available in Auto sequence advance mode.

Category.Name: SequenceControlConfiguration
Category.ToolTip: This category includes items that control the sequence set advance
Category.Description: The controls for the sequence set advance allow selecting a sequence advance mode, selecting the source for controlling advance, and performing the related settings.

Enumeration.Name: SequenceAdvanceMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the sequence set advance mode
Enumeration.Description: Selects the sequence set advance mode. Possible values: Auto - automatic sequence set advance as images are acquired. Controlled - sequence set advance controlled by settable source. Free selection - the sequence sets are selected according to the states of the input lines.

EnumEntry.Name: Auto
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Automatic sequence set advance
EnumEntry.Description: Automatic sequence set advance as images are acquired.

EnumEntry.Name: Controlled
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sequence set advance controlled by settable source
EnumEntry.Description: Sequence set advance controlled by settable source.

EnumEntry.Name: FreeSelection
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The sequence sets are selected according to the states of the input lines
EnumEntry.Description: The sequence sets are selected according to the states of the input lines as the frame triggers occur.

Enumeration.Name: SequenceControlSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects between sequence restart or sequence set advance
Enumeration.Description: Selects between controls for sequence restart or sequence set advance.

EnumEntry.Name: Restart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects controls for sequence restart
EnumEntry.Description: Selects controls for sequence restart.

EnumEntry.Name: Advance
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects controls for sequence set advance
EnumEntry.Description: Selects controls for sequence set advance. Only available in Controlled sequence advance mode.

Enumeration.Name: SequenceControlSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the source for sequence control
Enumeration.Description: Selects the source for sequence control. Possible values: Disabled - advance via asynchronous advance. Always Active - automatic sequence set advance. The sequence repeat starts with sequence set index number 1. Line N - the source for sequence restart or sequence set advance is line N. CCN - the source for sequence restart or sequence set advance is CCN.

EnumEntry.Name: Disabled
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Advance via asynchronous advance only
EnumEntry.Description: Advance via asynchronous advance only.

EnumEntry.Name: AlwaysActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Automatic sequence set advance. The sequence repeat starts with sequence set index number 1
EnumEntry.Description: Automatic sequence set advance. The sequence repeat starts with sequence set index number 1.

EnumEntry.ToolTip: The source for sequence restart or sequence set advance is line 1
EnumEntry.Description: The source for sequence restart or sequence set advance is line 1.

Category.Name: AnalogControls
Category.ToolTip: This category includes items that control the analog characteristics of the video signal
Category.Description: This category includes items that control the analog characteristics of the video signal.

Enumeration.Name: GainAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Gain Auto is the 'automatic' counterpart of the manual gain feature.
Enumeration.Description: The gain auto function automatically adjusts the Auto Gain Raw parameter value within set limits, until a target average gray value for the pixel data from Auto Function AOI1 is reached.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Disables the Gain Auto function.
EnumEntry.Description: Disables the Gain Auto function.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets operation mode to 'once'.
EnumEntry.Description: When the 'once' mode of operation is selected, the parameter value is automatically adjusted until the related image property reaches the target value. After the automatic parameter value adjustment is complete, the auto function will automatically be set to 'off' and the new parameter value will be applied to the following images.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets operation mode to 'continuous'.
EnumEntry.Description: When the 'continuous' mode of operation is selected, the parameter value is automatically adjusted while images are acquired. The repeated automatic adjustment will proceed until the 'once' mode of operation is used or until the auto function is set to 'off'.

Integer.Name: GainRaw
Integer.ToolTip: This is an integer value that sets the selected gain control in device specific units
Integer.Description: Sets the 'raw' value of the selected gain control. The 'raw' value is an integer value that sets the selected gain control in units specific to the camera.

Float.Name: GainAbs
Float.ToolTip: This is a float value that sets the selected gain control in dB
Float.Description: Sets the 'absolute' value of the selected gain control. The 'absolute' value is a float value that sets the selected gain control in dB.

Enumeration.Name: GainSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the gain control to configure. Once a gain control has been selected, all changes to the gain settings will be applied to the selected control.
Enumeration.Description: This enumeration selects the gain control to configure. Once a gain control has been selected, all changes to the gain settings will be applied to the selected control.

EnumEntry.Name: All
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects all gain controls for adjustment
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects all available gain controls for adjustment.

EnumEntry.Name: AnalogAll
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects all analog gain controls for adjustment
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects all available analog gain controls for adjustment.

EnumEntry.Name: DigitalAll
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects all digital gain controls for adjustment

EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets gamma to user defined curve
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the the user configurable gamma curve.

EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets gamma to fixed sRGB curve.

Float.Name: Gamma
Float.ToolTip: This feature is used to perform gamma correction of pixel intensity.
Float.Description: This feature is used to perform gamma correction of pixel intensity. This is typically used to compensate for non-linearity of the display system (such as CRT).

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value indicates that the Bayer filter has a GR/BG alignment to the pixels in the acquired images.

EnumEntry.Name: Bayer_BG
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates that the Bayer filter has a BG/GR alignment to the pixels in the acquired images
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value indicates that the Bayer filter has a BG/GR alignment to the pixels in the acquired images.

EnumEntry.Name: None
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Indicates that no Bayer filter is present on the camera
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value indicates that no Bayer filter is present on the camera.

Boolean.Name: ProcessedRawEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables color improved RGB raw output
Boolean.Description: Enables color improvement of RGB data and provides for their output as RGB raw data. Only available for cameras with an RGB Bayer filter. Note: Make sure to also select a suitable raw pixel data output format.

Integer.Name: SpatialCorrection
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies the direction of imaging and the separation (consecutive numbers) of related line captures.
Integer.Description:
Specifies the direction of imaging and the separation (consecutive numbers) of related line captures. Related line captures will be combined.
Positive integer: The object will pass the top sensor line first.
Negative integer: The object will pass the bottom sensor line first.
In color cameras, the top sensor line is the green line, and the bottom sensor line is the blue line.

Enumeration.Name: SensorBitDepth
Enumeration.ToolTip: This feature selects the amount of data bits the sensor produces for one sample.
Enumeration.Description: This feature selects the amount of data bits the sensor produces for one sample.

Boolean.Name: ReverseX
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the horizontal flipping of the image.
Boolean.Description: This feature is used to flip horizontally the image sent by the device. The AOI is applied after the flipping.

Boolean.Name: ReverseY
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the vertical flipping of the image.
Boolean.Description: This feature is used to flip vertically the image sent by the device. The AOI is applied after the flipping.

Integer.Name: PixelDynamicRangeMin
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the minimum possible pixel value that could be transferred from the camera
Integer.Description: This a read only feature. It indicates the minimum possible pixel value that could be transferred from the camera.

Integer.Name: PixelDynamicRangeMax
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the maximum possible pixel value that could be transferred from the camera
Integer.Description: This a read only feature. It indicates the maximum possible pixel value that could be transferred from the camera.

Enumeration.Name: FieldOutputMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the mode to output the fields.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the mode to output the fields.

EnumEntry.Name: Field0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the mode to only output field 0.
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the mode to only output field 0.

EnumEntry.Name: Field1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the mode to only output field 1.
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the mode to only output field 1.

EnumEntry.Name: Field0First
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the mode to only output field 0 and field 1 in single frames. Starting with field 0.
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the mode to only output field 0 and field 1 in single frames. Starting with field 0.

EnumEntry.Name: ConcatenatedNewFields
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the mode to output a frame consisting of field 0 in the upper half and field 1 in the lower half of the frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the mode to output a frame consisting of field 0 in the upper half and field 1 in the lower half of the frame.

EnumEntry.Name: DeinterlacedNewFields
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the mode to output a frame generated by deinterlacing field 0 and field 1 using the deinterlacer selected by feature Deinterlacer.
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the mode to output a frame generated by deinterlacing field 0 and field 1 using the deinterlacer selected by feature Deinterlacer.

Enumeration.Name: Deinterlacer
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the deinterlacing algorithm to use in DeinterlacedNewFields Field Output Mode
Enumeration.Description: Selects the deinterlacing algorithm to use in DeinterlacedNewFields Field Output Mode

EnumEntry.Name: Weave
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the deinterlacing algorithm to weave the lines from field 0 and field 1.
EnumEntry.Description: Sets the deinterlacing algorithm to weave the lines from field 0 and field 1.

Enumeration.Name: TestImageSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selecting a test image from the list will enable the test image
Enumeration.Description: This enumeration provides a list of the available test images. Selecting a test image from the list will enable the test image.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameCounter

EnumEntry.Name: DeviceSpecific

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a camera specific pattern.

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with an 8 bit moving diagonal gray gradient feature test pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: MovingDiagonalGrayGradientFeatureTest_12Bit
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a 12 bit moving diagonal gray gradient feature test pattern
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a 12 bit moving diagonal gray gradient feature test pattern.
EnumEntry.DisplayName: Moving Diagonal Gray Gradient Feature Test (12 bit)

EnumEntry.Name: MovingDiagonalColorGradient
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a moving diagonal color gradient pattern
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a moving diagonal color gradient pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: Testimage1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 1 pattern
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 1 pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: Testimage2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 2 pattern
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 2 pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: Testimage3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 3 pattern
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 3 pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: Testimage4
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 4 pattern
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 4 pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: Testimage5
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 5 pattern
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 5 pattern.

EnumEntry.Name: Testimage6

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera to generate and transmit test images with a test image 7 pattern.

Enumeration.Name: SensorDigitizationTaps
Enumeration.ToolTip: This feature represents the number of digitized samples outputted simultaneously by the camera A/D conversion stage.
Enumeration.Description: This feature represents the number of digitized samples output simultaneously by the camera A/D conversion stage.

Integer.Name: SensorWidth
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the width of the camera's sensor in pixels
Integer.Description: This is a read only element. It is an integer that indicates the actual width of the camera's sensor in pixels.

Integer.Name: SensorHeight
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the height of the camera's sensor in pixels.
Integer.Description: This is a read only element. It is an integer that indicates the actual height of the camera's sensor in pixels.

Integer.Name: WidthMax
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the maximum allowed width of the image in pixels
Integer.Description: This is a read only element. It is an integer that indicates maximum allowed width of the image in pixels taking into account any function that may limit the allowed width.

Integer.Name: HeightMax
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the maximum allowed height of the image in pixels
Integer.Description: This is a read only element. It is an integer that indicates maximum allowed height of the image in pixels taking into account any function that may limit the allowed height.

Category.Name: ColorImprovementsControl
Category.ToolTip: This category includes items that control color improvement
Category.Description: This category includes items that control color improvement.

Enumeration.Name: ColorTransformationSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the matrix color transformation between color spaces
Enumeration.Description: Selects the matrix color transformation between color spaces. Generally, the related color spaces are used for internal processing: The color signals provided by the sensor are transformed to the RGB color space to allow further transformations (to account for the type of light source, for color adjustment, for white balance, etc.). The color transformation selected here does not refer to the color space selected for the transmission of image data out of the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: RGBtoRGB
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Matrix color transformation from RGB to RGB.
EnumEntry.Description: Matrix color transformation from RGB to RGB.

EnumEntry.Name: RGBtoYUV
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Matrix color transformation from YUV to RGB.
EnumEntry.Description: Matrix color transformation from YUV to RGB.

EnumEntry.Name: YUVtoRGB
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Matrix color transformation from RGB to YUV.
EnumEntry.Description: Matrix color transformation from RGB to YUV.

EnumEntry.Name: Daylight_6500K
EnumEntry.Description: D65 light source (backwards compatibility, use Daylight6500K instead)

EnumEntry.Name: Daylight6500K
EnumEntry.Description: D65 light source

Enumeration.Name: LightSourceSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the type of light source to be considered for matrix color transformation
Enumeration.Description: Selects the color transformation mode to select the type of light source to be considered for matrix color transformation.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: No matrix color transformation for specific light source is performed.
EnumEntry.Description: No matrix color transformation for specific light source is performed.

EnumEntry.Name: Custom
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Allows using a custom defined color transformation matrix.
EnumEntry.Description: Allows using a custom defined color transformation matrix.

EnumEntry.Name: Daylight
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The matrix is optimized for image acquisition with daylight of 5000 K.
EnumEntry.Description: A predefined matrix is used for matrix color transformation. The matrix is optimized for image acquisition with daylight of 5000 K.

EnumEntry.Name: Tungsten
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The matrix is optimized for image acquisition with tungsten incandescent light (3100 K).
EnumEntry.Description: A predefined matrix is used for matrix color transformation. The matrix is optimized for image acquisition with tungsten incandescent light (3100 K).

EnumEntry.Name: Daylight6500K
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The matrix is optimized for image acquisition with daylight of 6500 K.
EnumEntry.Description: A predefined matrix is used for matrix color transformation. The matrix is optimized for image acquisition with daylight of 6500 K.

Float.Name: ColorTransformationMatrixFactor
Float.ToolTip: Defines the extent to which the selected light source will be considered (float)
Float.Description: Sets a floating point value to define the extent to which the selected light source will be considered in color matrix transformation. If the value is set to 1 the selected light source will be fully considered. If the value is set to 0 the selected light source will not be considered.

Integer.Name: ColorTransformationMatrixFactorRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Defines the extent to which the selected light source will be considered (integer)
Integer.Description: Sets an integer value to define the extent to which the selected light source will be considered in color matrix transformation. If the value is set to 65536 the selected light source will be fully considered. If the value is set to 0 the selected light source will not be considered.

Enumeration.Name: ColorTransformationValueSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the element to be entered in the color transformation matrix.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the element to be entered in the 3 x 3 color transformation matrix for custom matrix color transformation. Note: Depending on the camera model, some elements in the color transformation matrix may be preset and can not be changed.

EnumEntry.Name: Gain00
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Element in row 0 and column 0 of the color transformation matrix.
EnumEntry.Description: Element in row 0 and column 0 of the color transformation matrix.

EnumEntry.Name: Gain01
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Element in row 0 and column 1 of the color transformation matrix.
EnumEntry.Description: Element in row 0 and column 1 of the color transformation matrix.

EnumEntry.Name: Gain02
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Element in row 0 and column 2 of the color transformation matrix.
EnumEntry.Description: Element in row 0 and column 2 of the color transformation matrix.

EnumEntry.Name: Gain10
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Element in row 1 and column 0 of the color transformation matrix.
EnumEntry.Description: Element in row 1 and column 0 of the color transformation matrix.

EnumEntry.Name: Gain11
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Element in row 1 and column 1 of the color transformation matrix
EnumEntry.Description: Element in row 1 and column 1 of the color transformation matrix

EnumEntry.Name: Gain12
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Element in row 1 and column 2 of the color transformation matrix.
EnumEntry.Description: Element in row 1 and column 2 of the color transformation matrix.

EnumEntry.Name: Gain20
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Element in row 2 and column 0 of the color transformation matrix.
EnumEntry.Description: Element in row 2 and column 0 of the color transformation matrix.

EnumEntry.Name: Gain21
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Element in row 2 and column 1 of the color transformation matrix.
EnumEntry.Description: Element in row 2 and column 1 of the color transformation matrix.

EnumEntry.Name: Gain22
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Element in row 2 and column 2 of the color transformation matrix.
EnumEntry.Description: Element in row 2 and column 2 of the color transformation matrix.

Float.Name: ColorTransformationValue
Float.ToolTip: Sets a floating point value for the selected element in the color transformation matrix
Float.Description: Sets a floating point value for the selected element in the color transformation matrix.

Integer.Name: ColorTransformationValueRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Sets an integer value for the selected element in the color transformation matrix
Integer.Description: Sets an integer value for the selected element in the color transformation matrix.

Boolean.Name: ColorAdjustmentEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables color adjustment
Boolean.Description: Enables color adjustment.

Command.Name: ColorAdjustmentReset
Command.Description: Allows returning to the color adjustment settings extant before the latest changes of the settings. This allows you undoing the latest unwanted changes of the color adjustment settings and returning to the preceding settings.

Enumeration.Name: ColorAdjustmentSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the color for color adjustment
Enumeration.Description: Selects the color for color adjustment. Those colors in the image will be adjusted where the selected color predominates.

EnumEntry.Name: Red
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects red for the adjustment of colors with predominant red.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects red for the adjustment of colors with predominant red.

EnumEntry.Name: Yellow
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects yellow for the adjustment of colors with predominant yellow.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects yellow for the adjustment of colors with predominant yellow.

EnumEntry.Name: Green
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects green the adjustment of colors with predominant green.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects green the adjustment of colors with predominant green.

EnumEntry.Name: Cyan
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects cyan for the adjustment of colors with predominant cyan.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects cyan for the adjustment of colors with predominant cyan.

EnumEntry.Name: Blue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects blue for the adjustment of colors with predominant blue.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects blue for the adjustment of colors with predominant blue.

EnumEntry.Name: Magenta
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects magenta for the adjustment of colors with predominant magenta.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects magenta for the adjustment of colors with predominant magenta.

Float.Name: ColorAdjustmentHue
Float.ToolTip: Adjustment of hue of the selected color (float)
Float.Description: Sets a floating point value for the adjustment of hue of the selected color.

Integer.Name: ColorAdjustmentHueRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Adjustment of hue of the selected color (integer)
Integer.Description: Sets an integer value for the adjustment of hue of the selected color.

Float.Name: ColorAdjustmentSaturation
Float.ToolTip: Adjustment of saturation of the selected color (float)
Float.Description: Sets a floating point value for the adjustment of saturation of the selected color.

Integer.Name: ColorAdjustmentSaturationRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Adjustment of saturation of the selected color (integer)
Integer.Description: Sets an integer value for the adjustment of saturation of the selected color.

Command.Name: BalanceWhiteReset
Command.Description: Allows returning to the color adjustment settings extant before the latest changes of the settings. This allows you undoing the latest unwanted changes of the color adjustment settings and returning to the preceding settings.

Enumeration.Name: BalanceWhiteAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Balance White Auto is the 'automatic' counterpart of the manual white balance feature.
Enumeration.Description: The automatic white balance is a two-step process: First, the Balance Ratio Abs parameter values for red, green, and blue are each set to 1.5. Then, assuming a 'grey world' model, the Balance Ratio Abs parameter values are adjusted such that the average gray values for the 'red' and 'blue' pixels match the average gray value for the 'green' pixels.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Disables the Balance White Auto function.
EnumEntry.Description: Disables the Balance White Auto function.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets operation mode to 'once'.
EnumEntry.Description: When the 'once' mode of operation is selected, the parameter value is automatically adjusted until the related image property reaches the target value. After the automatic parameter value adjustment is complete, the auto function will automatically be set to 'off' and the new parameter value will be applied to the following images.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets operation mode to 'continuous'.
EnumEntry.Description: When the 'continuous' mode of operation is selected, the parameter value is automatically adjusted while images are acquired. The repeated automatic adjustment will proceed until the 'once' mode of operation is used or until the auto function is set to 'off'.

Enumeration.Name: BalanceRatioSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects a balance ratio to configure. Once a balance ratio control has been selected, all changes to the balance ratio settings will be applied to the selected control.
Enumeration.Description: This enumeration selects a balance ratio control to configuration. Once a balance ratio control has been selected, all changes to the balance ratio settings will be applied to the selected control.

EnumEntry.Name: Red
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the red balance ratio control for adjustment
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the red balance ratio control for adjustment.

EnumEntry.Name: Green
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the green balance ratio control for adjustment
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the green balance ratio control for adjustment.

EnumEntry.Name: Blue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the blue balance ratio control for adjustment
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the blue balance ratio control for adjustment.

Float.Name: BalanceRatioAbs
Float.ToolTip: Sets the value of the selected balance ratio control as a float
Float.Description: This value sets the selected balance ratio control as a float value.

Integer.Name: BalanceRatioRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the value of the selected balance ratio control as an integer
Integer.Description: This value sets the selected balance ratio control as an integer.

Category.Name: AOI
Category.ToolTip: This category includes items used to set the size and position of the area of interest
Category.Description: This category includes items used to set the size and position of the area of interest

Integer.Name: Width
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the width of the area of interest in pixels
Integer.Description: This value sets the width of the area of interest in pixels.

Integer.Name: Height
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the height of the area of interest in pixels
Integer.Description: This value sets the height of the area of interest in pixels.

Integer.Name: OffsetX
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the X offset (left offset) of the area of interest in pixels
Integer.Description: This value sets the X offset (left offset) for the area of interest in pixels, i.e., the distance in pixels between the left side of the sensor and the left side of the image area.

Integer.Name: OffsetY
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the Y offset (top offset) for the area of interest in pixels
Integer.Description: This value sets the Y offset (top offset) for the area of interest, i.e., the distance in pixels between the top of the sensor and the top of the image area.

Boolean.Name: CenterX
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the horizontal centering of the image.
Boolean.Description: This feature is used to center the image horizontally.

Boolean.Name: CenterY
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the vertical centering of the image.
Boolean.Description: This feature is used to center the image vertically.

Integer.Name: BinningVertical
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the number of adjacent vertical pixes to be summed
Integer.Description: Sets the number of binned adjacent vertical pixels. Their charges will be summed and reported out of the camera as a single pixel.

Integer.Name: BinningHorizontal
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the number of adjacent horizontal pixes to be summed
Integer.Description: Sets the number of binned adjacent horizontal pixels. Their charges will be summed and reported out of the camera as a single pixel.

Enumeration.Name: LegacyBinningVertical
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the vertical binning feature
Enumeration.Description: This enumeration sets the vertical binning feature.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets vertical binning to disabled
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets vertical binning to disabled.

EnumEntry.Name: Two_Rows
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets vertical binning to 2 rows
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets vertical binning to 2 rows.

Integer.Name: DecimationVertical
Integer.ToolTip: Sets vertical sub-sampling
Integer.Description: Vertical sub-sampling of the image. This has the net effect of reducing the vertical resolution (height) of the image by the specified vertical decimation factor. A value of 1 indicates that the camera performs no vertical decimation.

Integer.Name: DecimationHorizontal
Integer.ToolTip: Sets horizontal sub-sampling
Integer.Description: Horizontal sub-sampling of the image. This has the net effect of reducing the horizontal resolution (width) of the image by the specified horizontal decimation factor. A value of 1 indicates that the camera performs no horizontal decimation.

Boolean.Name: StackedZoneImagingEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the stacked zone imaging feature.
Boolean.Description: Enables the stacked zone imaging feature.

Integer.Name: StackedZoneImagingIndex
Integer.ToolTip: This value sets the zone to access.
Integer.Description: This value sets the zone to access.

Boolean.Name: StackedZoneImagingZoneEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the selected zone.
Boolean.Description: Enables the selected zone.

Integer.Name: StackedZoneImagingZoneOffsetY
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the Y offset (top offset) for the selected zone.
Integer.Description: Sets the Y offset (top offset) for the selected zone.

Integer.Name: StackedZoneImagingZoneHeight
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the height for the selected zone.
Integer.Description: Sets the height for the selected zone.

Category.Name: AcquisitionTrigger
Category.ToolTip: This category includes items used to set the image acquisition parameters and to start and stop acquisition
Category.Description: This category includes items used to set the image acquisition parameters and to start and stop acquisition

Boolean.Name: EnableBurstAcquisition
Boolean.ToolTip: When enabled, the maximum frame rate does not depend on the image transfer rate out of the camera.
Boolean.Description:
When enabled, the maximum frame rate onyl depends on sensor timing and timing of the trigger sequence, and not on the image transfer rate out of the camera.
Note: The maximum number of triggers within a burst sequence is limited. If the maximum number is exceeded, images may be damaged or lost.

Enumeration.Name: AcquisitionMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the image acquisition mode
Enumeration.Description: This enumeration sets the image acquisition mode.

EnumEntry.Name: SingleFrame
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the acquisition mode to single frame
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera's acquisition mode to single frame

EnumEntry.Name: MultiFrame
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the acquisition mode to multi frame
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera's acquisition mode to multi frame.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the acquisition mode to continuous
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the camera's acquisition mode to continuous.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStart
Command.Description: This command starts the acquisition of images. If the camera is set for single frame acquisition, it will start acquisition of one frame. If the camera is set for continuous frame acquisition, it will start continuous acquisition of frames.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStop
Command.Description: If the camera is set for continuous image acquisition and acquisition has been started, this command stops the acquisition of images.

Command.Name: AcquisitionAbort
Command.ToolTip: Immediately aborts the acquisition of images
Command.Description: This command will immediately abort any image acquisition process that is currently in progress.

Integer.Name: AcquisitionFrameCount
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the number of frames acquired in the multiframe acquisition mode
Integer.Description: This value sets the number of frames acquired in the multiframe acquisition mode

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the trigger type to configure. Once a trigger type has been selected, all changes to the trigger settings will be applied to the selected trigger.
Enumeration.Description: This enumeration selects the trigger type to configure. Once a trigger type has been selected, all changes to the trigger settings will be applied to the selected trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the acquisition start trigger for configuration
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the acquisition start trigger for configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the acquisition end trigger for configuration
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the acquisition end trigger for configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the acquisition active trigger for configuration
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the acquisition active trigger for configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the frame start trigger for configuration
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the frame start trigger for configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the frame end trigger for configuration
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the frame end trigger for configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the frame active trigger for configuration
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the frame active trigger for configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: LineStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the line start trigger for configuration
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the line start trigger for configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the exposure start trigger for configuration
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the exposure start trigger for configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the exposure end trigger for configuration
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the exposure end trigger for configuration.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the exposure active trigger for configuration
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the exposure active trigger for configuration.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the mode for the selected trigger
Enumeration.Description: This enumeration sets the trigger mode for the selected trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the mode for the selected trigger to off
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the mode for the selected trigger to off.

EnumEntry.Name: On
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the mode for the selected trigger to on
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the mode for the selected trigger to on.

Command.Name: TriggerSoftware
Command.ToolTip: Generates a software trigger signal that is used when the trigger source is set to 'software'
Command.Description: This command generates a software trigger signal. The software trigger signal will be used if the trigger source is set to 'software'.

Boolean.Name: TriggerPartialClosingFrame
Boolean.ToolTip: Determines whether a partial or complete frame is transmitted when the frame start trigger prematurely transitions.
Boolean.Description: This feature determines whether a partial or a complete frame is transmitted when the frame start trigger is used with Level High or Level Low and when the frame start trigger signal transitions while the frame is still being acquired.

Float.Name: TriggerDelayAbs
Float.ToolTip: Sets the trigger delay time in microseconds.
Float.Description: This float value sets the absolute trigger delay in microseconds to apply after the trigger reception before effectively activating it.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerDelaySource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the kind of trigger delay.
Enumeration.Description: Selects wheter trigger delay is defined as a time interval or as a number of consecutive line triggers.

EnumEntry.Name: Time_us
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the trigger delay to be expressed as a time interval (in microseconds).
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the trigger delay to be expressed as a time interval (in microseconds).

EnumEntry.Name: LineTrigger
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the trigger delay to be expressed as a number of line triggers.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the trigger delay to be expressed as a number of consecutive line triggers.

Integer.Name: TriggerDelayLineTriggerCount
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the trigger delay expressed as number of line triggers.
Integer.Description: This integer value sets the trigger delay expressed as a number of consecutive line triggers to apply after the trigger reception before effectively activating it.

Enumeration.Name: ExposureAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Exposure Auto is the 'automatic' counterpart to manually setting an 'absolute' exposure time.
Enumeration.Description: The exposure auto function automatically adjusts the Auto Exposure Time Abs parameter value within set limits, until a target average gray value for the pixel data of the related Auto Function AOI is reached.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Disables the Exposure Auto function.
EnumEntry.Description: Disables the Exposure Auto function.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets operation mode to 'once'.
EnumEntry.Description: When the 'once' mode of operation is selected, the parameter value is automatically adjusted until the related image property reaches the target value. After the automatic parameter value adjustment is complete, the auto function will automatically be set to 'off' and the new parameter value will be applied to the following images.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets operation mode to 'continuous'.
EnumEntry.Description: When the 'continuous' mode of operation is selected, the parameter value is automatically adjusted while images are acquired. The repeated automatic adjustment will proceed until the 'once' mode of operation is used or until the auto function is set to 'off'.

Integer.Name: ExposureTimeRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the 'raw' exposure time. Actual exposure time = raw exposure setting x exposure time base abs setting
Integer.Description: This value sets an integer that will be used as a multiplier for the exposure timebase. The actual exposure time equals the current exposure time raw setting times the current exposure time base abs setting.

Float.Name: ExposureTimeAbs
Float.ToolTip: Directly sets the camera's exposure time in microseconds
Float.Description: This float value sets the camera's exposure time in microseconds.

Float.Name: ExposureTimeBaseAbs
Float.ToolTip: Sets the time base (in microseconds) that is used when the exposure time is set with the 'exposure time raw' setting
Float.Description: This float value sets the time base (in microseconds) that is used when the exposure time is set with the 'raw' setting.

Boolean.Name: ExposureTimeBaseAbsEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the use of the exposure time base
Boolean.Description: This value enables the use of the exposure time base.

Float.Name: AcquisitionLineRateAbs
Float.ToolTip: Sets the camera's acquisition line rate in lines per second
Float.Description: Sets the 'absolute' value of the acquisition line rate. The 'absolute' value is a float value that sets the acquisition line rate in lines per second.

Float.Name: ResultingLineRateAbs
Float.ToolTip: Indicates the maximum allowed line acquisition rate (in lines per second) given the current settings for the area of interest, exposure time, and bandwidth
Float.Description: Indicates the 'absolute' value of the maximum allowed acquisition line rate. The 'absolute' value is a float value that indicates the maximum allowed acquisition line rate in lines per second given the current settings for the area of interest, exposure time, and bandwidth.

Float.Name: AcquisitionFrameRateAbs
Float.ToolTip: If the acquisition frame rate feature is enabled, this value sets the camera's acquisition frame rate in frames per second
Float.Description: Sets the 'absolute' value of the acquisition frame rate. The 'absolute' value is a float value that sets the acquisition frame rate in frames per second.

Boolean.Name: AcquisitionFrameRateEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables setting the camera's acquisition frame rate to a specified value
Boolean.Description: This boolean value enables setting the camera's acquisition frame rate to a specified value.

Float.Name: ResultingFrameRateAbs
Float.ToolTip: Indicates the maximum allowed frame acquisition rate (in frames per second) given the current settings for the area of interest, exposure time, and bandwidth
Float.Description: Indicates the 'absolute' value of the maximum allowed acquisition frame rate. The 'absolute' value is a float value that indicates the maximum allowed acquisition frame rate in frames per second given the current settings for the area of interest, exposure time, and bandwidth.

Boolean.Description: This boolean value enables the frame timeout.

Float.Name: FrameTimeoutAbs
Float.ToolTip: Sets the frame timeout in microseconds.
Float.Description: Sets the frame timeout in microseconds. When the timeout expires before a frame acquisition is complete, a partial frame will be delivered.

Enumeration.Name: LineMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the mode for the selected line
Enumeration.Description: This feature controls whether the physical Line is used to Input or Output a signal. When a Line supports input and output mode, the default state is Input to avoid possible electrical contention. Line Mode can take any of the following values: Input: The selected physical line is used to input an electrical signal. Output: The selected physical line is used to output an electrical signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Input
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the mode for the selected line to input
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the mode for the selected line to input.

EnumEntry.Name: Output
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Sets the mode for the selected line to output
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the mode for the selected line to output.

Enumeration.Description: This enumeration selects the internally generated camera signal (source signal) for the selected line when the selected line is an output.

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the source signal for the selected output line to off.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureActive

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the source signal for the selected output line to exposure active.

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value associates the LineTriggerWait software status as a signal level with the selected output line.

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value sets the source signal for the selected output line to timer 1 active.

Enumeration.Name: LineFormat
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the electrical configuration of the selected line
Enumeration.Description: This feature controls the current electrical format of the selected physical input or output Line. Line Format can take any of the following values: No Connect: The Line is not connected. Tri-state: The Line is currently in Tri-state mode (Not driven). TTL: The Line is currently accepting or sending TTL level signals. LVDS: The Line is currently accepting or sending LVDS level signals. RS-422: The Line is currently accepting or sending RS-422 level signals. Opto-coupled: The Line is Opto-coupled.

Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the phase of the shaft encoder.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the phase of the shaft encoder as input for the shaft encoder module.

EnumEntry.Description: Selects phase A of the shaft encoder as input for the shaft encoder module.

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects input line 7 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.

EnumEntry.Name: Line8
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects input line 8 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects input line 8 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.

EnumEntry.Name: CC1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects CC1 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects CC1 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.

EnumEntry.Name: CC2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects CC2 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects CC2 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.

EnumEntry.Name: CC3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects CC3 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects CC3 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.

EnumEntry.Name: CC4
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects CC4 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects CC4 as signal source for the shaft encoder module.

Enumeration.Name: ShaftEncoderModuleMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the circumstances for the shaft encoder module to output trigger signals.
Enumeration.Description: This enumeration value selects the circumstances for the shaft encoder module to output trigger signals.

EnumEntry.Name: AnyDirection
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Output of trigger signals for forward and reverse ticks provided the reverse counter is not counting.
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects that the shaft encoder module will output trigger signals for forward and reverse ticks provided the reverse counter is neither incrementing nor decrementing.

EnumEntry.Name: ForwardOnly
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Output of trigger signals for forward ticks only provided the reverse counter is not decrementing.
EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects that the shaft encoder module will output trigger signals for forward ticks only provided the reverse counter is not decrementing.

Enumeration.Name: ShaftEncoderModuleCounterMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the counting mode of the tick counter.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the counting mode of the tick counter of the shaft encoder module.

EnumEntry.Name: FollowDirection
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Tick counter increments for forward ticks and decrements for reverse ticks.
EnumEntry.Description: The tick counter of the shaft encoder module increments for forward ticks and decrements for reverse ticks.

EnumEntry.Name: IgnoreDirection
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Tick counter increments for forward ticks and for reverse ticks.
EnumEntry.Description: The tick counter of the shaft encoder module increments for forward ticks for reverse ticks, i.e. the tick counts are incremented regardless of the direction of movement.

Integer.Name: ShaftEncoderModuleCounter
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the current value of the tick counter.
Integer.Description: This integer value (read only) indicates the current value of the tick counter of the shaft encoder module.

Integer.Name: ShaftEncoderModuleCounterMax
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the maximum value for the tick counter.
Integer.Description: This integer value sets the maximum value for the tick counter of the shaft encoder module (range: 0 to 32767). If the tick counter is incrementing and it reaches the set maximum, it willl roll over to 0. If the tick counter is decrementing and it reaches 0, it willl roll back to the set maximum.

Command.Name: ShaftEncoderModuleCounterReset
Command.Description: This command resets the tick counter count of the shaft encoder module to 0.

Integer.Name: ShaftEncoderModuleReverseCounterMax
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the maximum value for the reverse counter.
Integer.Description: This integer value sets the maximum value for the reverse counter of the shaft encoder module (range: 0 to 32767).
Integer.DisplayName: Shaft Encoder Module Max Reverse Counter

Command.Name: ShaftEncoderModuleReverseCounterReset
Command.Description: This command resets the reverse counter of the shaft encoder module to 0 and informs the module that the current direction of conveyor movement is forward. Reset must be carried out before the first conveyor movement in the forward direction.
Command.DisplayName: Shaft Encoder Module Reverse Counter Reset

EnumEntry.Description: Selects the output of the shaft encoder module as the input source for the frequency converter module.

Enumeration.Name: FrequencyConverterSignalAlignment
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the signal transition relationships between received and generated signals.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the signal transition relationships between the signals received from the pre-divider sub-module and the signals generated by the multiplier sub-module.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: For the rising edge of each received signal a rising edge of a generated signal is provided.
EnumEntry.Description: For the rising edge of each signal received from the pre-divider sub-module a phase-locked rising edge of a signal generated by the multiplier sub-module is provided.

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: For the falling edge of each received signal a falling edge of a generated signal is provided.
EnumEntry.Description: For the falling edge of each signal received from the pre-divider sub-module a phase-locked falling edge of a signal generated by the multiplier sub-module is provided.

Integer.Name: FrequencyConverterPreDivider
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the pre-divider value for the pre-divider sub-module.
Integer.Description: Sets an integer value as the pre-divider for the pre-divider sub-module.

Integer.Name: FrequencyConverterMultiplier
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the multiplier value for the multiplier sub-module.
Integer.Description: Sets an integer value as the multiplier for the multiplier sub-module.

Integer.Name: FrequencyConverterPostDivider
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the post-divider value for the post-divider sub-module.
Integer.Description: Sets an integer value as the post-divider for the post-divider sub-module.

Boolean.Name: FrequencyConverterPreventOvertrigger
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables overtriggering protection.
Boolean.Description: This feature ensures that the multiplier sub-module does not provide a generated signal at a too high frequency that would cause camera overtriggering.

Category.Description: This category includes items used to control the operation of the camera's timers

Float.Name: TimerDurationTimebaseAbs
Float.ToolTip: Sets the time base (in microseconds) that is used when a timer duration is set with the 'timer duration raw' setting
Float.Description: This float value sets the time base (in microseconds) that is used when a timer duration is set with the 'raw' setting.

Float.Name: TimerDelayTimebaseAbs
Float.ToolTip: Sets the time base (in microseconds) that is used when a timer delay is set with the 'timer delay raw' setting
Float.Description: This float value sets the time base (in microseconds) that is used when a timer delay is set with the 'raw' setting.

Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the timer to configure. Once a timer has been selected, all changes to the timer settings will be applied to the selected timer.

Float.Description: This float value sets the duration for the selected timer in microseconds.

Integer.Name: TimerDurationRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the 'raw' duration for the selected timer. Actual duration = raw timer duration setting x timer duration time base abs setting
Integer.Description: This value sets an integer that will be used as a multiplier for the timer duration timebase. The actual duration time equals the current timer duration raw setting times the current timer duration time base abs setting.

Float.Name: TimerDelayAbs
Float.ToolTip: Directly sets the delay for the selected timer in microseconds
Float.Description: This float value sets the delay for the selected timer in microseconds.

Integer.Name: TimerDelayRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the 'raw' delay for the selected timer. Actual delay = raw timer delay setting x timer delay time base abs setting
Integer.Description: This value sets an integer that will be used as a multiplier for the timer delay timebase. The actual delay time equals the current timer delay raw setting times the current timer delay time base abs setting.

Float.Name: ClInterLineDelayAbs
Float.ToolTip: Sets the delay between end of transmission and start of transmission of consecutive lines
Float.Description: The Inter-line Delay Abs parameter sets the delay between the end of transmission of a line and the start of transmission of the next line. The parameter sets a floating point value to express the delay in microseconds. The set value will be automatically adjusted to the nearest value that can be expressed as a multiple of the period of the currently selected pixel clock. The line valid signal (LVAL) remains low during the set delay. The default value of the parameter is the minimum allowed inter-line delay.

Integer.Name: ClInterLineDelayRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the delay between end of transmission and start of transmission of consecutive lines
Integer.Description: The Inter-line Delay Raw parameter sets the delay between the end of transmission of a line and the start of transmission of the next line. The parameter sets an integer value to express the delay as a number pixel clock cycles. The line valid signal (LVAL) remains low during the set number of pixel clock cycles. The default value of the parameter is the minimum allowed number of inter-line clock cycles.

Integer.Name: PayloadSize
Integer.ToolTip: Size of the payload in bytes
Integer.Description: Size of the payload in bytes. This is the total number of bytes sent in the payload. Image data + chunk data if present. No packet headers.

Category.Name: UserSets
Category.ToolTip: This category includes items that control the configuration sets feature that is used to save sets of parameters in the camera

Command.Name: UserSetLoad
Command.ToolTip: Loads the selected configuration into the camera's volatile memory and makes it the active configuration set. Once the selected set is loaded, the parameters in the selected set will control the camera.
Command.Description: This command loads the selected configuration set from the non-volatile memory in the camera to the volatile memory and makes the selected set the active configuration set. Once the selected set is loaded, the parameters in the selected set will control the camera.

Command.Name: UserSetSave
Command.ToolTip: Saves the current active configuration set into the selected user set.
Command.Description: This command copies the parameters in the current active configuration set into the selected user set in the camera's non-volatile memory.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the configuration set to load, save, or configure. Once a configuration set has been selected, all changes to the configuration set settings will be applied to the selected configuration set.
Enumeration.Description: This enumeration selects the configuration set to load, save or configure. Possible values for the User Set Selector are: Default: Selects a configuration set that contains factory settings. User Set 1: Selects the first user set. When the Default configuration set is selected and loaded using User Set Load, the device must be in default factory settings state and must make sure the mandatory continuous acquisition use case works directly. Default User Set is read-only and cannot be modified.

Category.ToolTip: This category includes items that parameterize the Auto Functions
Category.Description: This category includes items that parameterize the Auto Functions

Integer.Name: AutoTargetValue
Integer.ToolTip: Target average grey value for Gain Auto and Exposure Auto
Integer.Description: The target average grey value may range from nearly black to nearly white. Note that this range of gray values applies to 8 bit and to 16 bit (12 bit effective) output modes. Accordingly, also for 16 bit output modes, black is represented by 0 and white by 255.

Float.Name: GrayValueAdjustmentDampingAbs
Float.ToolTip: Gray value adjustment damping for Gain Auto and Exposure Auto
Float.Description: The gray value adjustment damping parameter controls the rate by which pixel gray values are changed when Exposure Auto and/or Gain Auto are enabled.

Integer.Name: GrayValueAdjustmentDampingRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Gray value adjustment damping for Gain Auto and Exposure Auto
Integer.Description: The gray value adjustment damping parameter controls the rate by which pixel gray values are changed when Exposure Auto and/or Gain Auto are enabled.

Integer.Name: AutoGainRawLowerLimit

Integer.Description: Lower limit of the Auto Gain (Raw) parameter

Integer.Name: AutoGainRawUpperLimit
Integer.ToolTip: Upper limit of the Auto Gain (Raw) parameter
Integer.Description: Upper limit of the Auto Gain (Raw) parameter

Float.Name: AutoExposureTimeAbsLowerLimit

Float.Description: Lower limit of the Auto Exposure Time (Abs) [us] parameter

Float.Name: AutoExposureTimeAbsUpperLimit

Float.Description: Upper limit of the Auto Exposure Time (Abs) [us] parameter

Enumeration.Description: Selects the profile for controlling gain and shutter simultaneously.

EnumEntry.Name: GainMinimum

EnumEntry.Description: When this setting is selected tries to keep the gain value at its minimum.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureMinimum
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Exposure Time at minimum
EnumEntry.Description: When this setting is selected tries to keep the exposure time value at its minimum.

Category.Description: An Auto Function AOI specifies a portion of the sensor array. Only the pixel data from the specified portion will be used for auto function control.

Integer.Description: This value sets the width of the auto function area of interest in pixels.

Integer.Name: AutoFunctionAOIHeight

Integer.Description: This value sets the height of the auto function area of interest in pixels.

Integer.Name: AutoFunctionAOIOffsetX

Integer.Description: This value sets the starting column of the auto function area of interest in pixels.

Integer.Name: AutoFunctionAOIOffsetY

Integer.Description: This value sets the starting line of the auto function area of interest in pixels.

EnumEntry.Name: AOI2

Boolean.Description: Enables color overexposure compensation.

Float.Description: Sets the color overexposure compensation factor controlling the extent of compensation for the selected C.O.C. AOI.

Integer.Description: Sets the raw value for the color overexposure compensation factor.

Integer.Description: Sets the width for the selected Color Overexposure Compensation AOI.

Integer.Description: Sets the vertical offset for the selected Color Overexposure Compensation AOI.

Boolean.ToolTip: Enables denoising
Boolean.Description: Enables denoising.

Float.Name: ContrastAbs
Float.ToolTip: Shows the actual value of the contrast used in the function for controlling image contrast
Float.Description: Shows tha actual value of the contrast used in the function for controlling image contrast. Image contrast will increase as values are increased.

Integer.Name: ContrastRaw
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the 'raw' value (integer) of the constant used in the function for controlling image contrast
Integer.Description: Sets the 'raw' value (integer) of the constant used in the function for controlling image contrast. The actual value used equals the set raw value times a factory-set base value. Image contrast will increase as the raw values are increased.

Integer.Name: ContrastPivot
Integer.ToolTip: Sets the position of the pivot point used in the function for controlling image contrast
Integer.Description: Sets the position of the pivot point used in the function for controlling image contrast. Pixel values below the pivot point will be decreased. Pixel values above the pivot point will be increased. The range of available settings (0..255) applies to all pixel data format bit depths.

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the User Shading Set 2 as the bootup shading set.

Enumeration.Description: This enumeration selects the shading set to which the activate command will be applied.

EnumEntry.Description: This enumeration value selects the default shading set for activation by the activate command.

Command.Description: This command copies the selected shading set from the camera's non-volatile memory into the volatile memory. Shading correction is performed using the shading set in the volatile memory.

EnumEntry.Name: Read
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects read-only open mode
EnumEntry.Description: This mode selects read-only open mode.

EnumEntry.Name: Write
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects write-only open mode
EnumEntry.Description: This mode selects write-only open mode.

Register.Name: FileAccessBuffer
Register.Description: The File Access Buffer feature defines the intermediate access buffer that allows the exchange of data between the device file storage and the application.

Integer.Name: FileAccessOffset
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer
Integer.Description: This feature controls the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer.

Integer.Name: FileAccessLength
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer
Integer.Description: This feature controls the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer.

Enumeration.Name: FileOperationStatus
Enumeration.ToolTip: Represents the file operation execution status
Enumeration.Description: The File Operation Status feature represents the file operation execution status.

EnumEntry.Name: Success
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Successful file operation
EnumEntry.Description: This value denotes a successful file operation.

EnumEntry.Name: Failure
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Failing file operation
EnumEntry.Description: This value denotes a failing file operation.

Integer.Name: FileOperationResult
Integer.ToolTip: Represents the file operation result
Integer.Description: The File Operation Result feature represents the file operation result. For Read or Write operations, the number of successfully read/written bytes is returned.

Integer.Name: FileSize
Integer.ToolTip: Represents the size of the selected file
Integer.Description: The File Size feature represents the size of the selected file in bytes.

Command.Name: FileOperationExecute
Command.Description: The File Operation Execute feature is the command that executes the operation selected by FileOperationSelector on the selected file.

Enumeration.Name: ServiceBoardIdSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Select which ID to show
